required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Obex, a Nutritional Supplement, in Overweight and Obese Spanish Women
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Obex®, a Nutritional Supplement, in Overweight or Obese Women

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the effects of a dietary supplement (Obex®) on anthropometric and physiological variables in Spanish women between 35 and 60 years who are overweight or obese.

detailed_description.textblock: The nutritional supplement consists of natural plant extracts such as Caralluma fimbriata, Phaseolus vulgaris, Acai Berry and other antiobesity agents: ornithine, carnitine fumarate, essential fatty acids and certain amino acids, vitamins and minerals.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of OBEX on skinfolds
primary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatment and three months after concluded the treatment
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is to evaluate the effect of the treatment with OBEX on skinfold thickness of the biceps, triceps, subscapular and suprailiac as compared to placebo group at 2 months of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of OBEX on the waist and hip circumferences
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatment and three months after concluded the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Waist and Hip circumferences will be measured at baseline and at the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of Obex on the arm circumference.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatment and three months after concluded the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The arm circumference will be measured at baseline and at the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of Obex on the percentage of body fat
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatment and three months after concluded the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Body fat (%) will be assessed at baseline and the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of Obex on the muscular mass
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatments and three months after concluded the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The muscular mass will be measured at baseline and at the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of Obex on arterial blood pressures.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatment and three months after concluded the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The arterial BP will be evaluated at baseline and at the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of Obex on fasting glucose and cholesterol levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two months of treatment and three months after concluded the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The fasting glucose and cholesterol levels will be evaluated at baseline and at the end of treatment.

arm_group.description: Obex will be administered two sachets daily dissolved in a glass of water, 30 minutes before lunch and dinner during two months. Patients will be recommended to comply with a healthy lifestyle through diet and exercise.

Placebo will be administered two sachets daily dissolved in a glass of water, 30 minutes before lunch and dinner during two months. Patients will be recommended to comply with a healthy lifestyle through diet and exercise.

intervention.description: After concluded the two months of treatment, patients will be follow-up during three months without consumption of Obex.
After concluded the two months of treatment, patients will be follow-up during three months without consumption of the placebo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged between 35 and 60 years.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) greater than 27 kg/m² and lower than 35 kg/m²
- Ability to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any endocrine, hepatic, renal or cardiovascular disease.
- History of bariatric surgery
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Concomitant disease with reduced life expectancy
- Severe psychiatric conditions
- Drug dependence
